docs.lead_paragraph: Sermon by Dr. Duff. Sunday evening Dr. DUFF, the distinguished Missionary of Calcutta, delivered a particularly able and instructive term n in the presence of a very large congregation, at the Presbyterian Church, corner of Crosby and Grand-streets.

headline.main: A TOUR IN THE SOUTH-WEST.; Sketches of Life in the South-Western Frontier. INCIDENTS AND OBSERVATIONS.

docs.lead_paragraph: This town is at thc end of the old Spanish trail, or " King's Road," by which all the trade of the Northern States of Mexico with the United States was once carried on. The road has since become the great thoroughfare of the Texas emigration, and this town has, until lately, been the great starting-point of land travel for those who came up the Red River by steamboat. No boats

headline.main: The Modern Literature and Literary Men of France.; The French Histerlans. LECTURE III.

docs.lead_paragraph: M. PAUL ARPIN'S third lecture, on Saturday evening last, was attended by a large and attentive audience. It was especially devoted to a consideration of that class of French historians who have, during the last century, achieved the historical reform and applied it to past ages, the lecturer reserving for a future discourse, the historians of the present or revolutionary period.

docs.lead_paragraph: The epidemic had not reached its height, when the vast capacity and resources of the Charity Hospital became inadequate to accommodate all the sick. A wise forethought had anticipated this difficulty, by the establishment of four Infirmaries in different parts of the city, under the joint care and direction of the Board of Health. ese

docs.lead_paragraph: From the Hartford Daily Times. At about 2 o'clock this afternoon, (March 2,) the new steam-boiler, just placed in the car factory of this city, burst with a terrible explosion, shattering the entire building, and laying all that part occupied by the blacksmiths, engine, , in complete ruins. The shock came in an instant, when there was no apparent cause for it.

headline.main: FROM HAVANA.; BLACK TROOPS. Release of American Sailors--Port Regulations about Coal--Arrival of United States Visiters--The Market.

docs.lead_paragraph: We have a new feature entering into the combination of our obligations and affections for the crown, drawing our fealty to the foot of the throne by a force that must be irresistible. I allude to the initiative measures for the formation o f corps of black troops, to protect the property and lives of the white population of Cuba.

headline.main: THIRTY-THIRD CONGRESS......First Session.; SENATE.... LAND GRANTS. REMARKS OF MR. CHASE. INTERESTING FROM MR. BADGER. MR. CHASE ON NORTHERN EDITORS. HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES. GUANO. HOMESTEAD RILL.

docs.lead_paragraph: LAND GRANTS. Mr. STUART, from the Committe on Public Lands, asked to be discharged from the consideration of memorials praying for grants of land to the State of New-York, for the construction of a ship canal around the Falls of Niagara.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; ST. DAVID'S ANNIVERSARY. The Cambrian Festival. CAS GIOR NA CHAERO Y WLAD AI MACO." Board of Education. WAGES IN NEW-YORK. NEBRASKA. MARINE COURT.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Welsh residents of this City met at Tammany Hall, on Wednesday evening, to celebrate the anniversary of Cambria's Patron Saint. Over one hundred persons sat down to an excellent dinner at 8 o'clock in the long supper-room. An unusual charm was given to the proceedings by the presence of ladies, of whom some thirty graced the festive board. t the head of the room

docs.lead_paragraph: The popular English author, WILLIAM HOWITT, has just published an account of his experience at the gold diggings in Australia, which quite takes the romantic coloring from the picture, and leaves only very sombre tints behind.

headline.main: LATEST INTELLIGENCE; By Telegraph to the New-York Daily Times. FROM WASHINGTON. THE NEBRASKA EXCITEMENT. CONGRESSIONAL PROCEEDINGS. SPEECH OF SENATOR CLAYTON. Interesting Proceedings in the House. ELECTION OF A PRINTER. JUDGE NICHOLSON ELECTED.

docs.lead_paragraph: Judge NICHOLSON said this morning to Mr. DEAN and other anti-Nebraska Democracts, that he would not make fealty to the Nebraska bill, a test of Democracy--that there were no tests outside the "Baltimore Platform." This united the party and secured NICHOLSON's election.
